gurmukhi: AYs pRIq hir hoq lg`ieXY ]qb hI nwQ inrMjn p`ieXY ]ibn iciq dIn hwQ nhI AwvY ]cwr byd iem Byd bqwvY ]199]
transliteration: Ais Preet Hot Lagadai|| Tah Hinaath Niranjan Paeai|| Bin Chit(i) Deen Haath Nahiaavai|| Chaaaar Bed Im Bhed Bataavai||199||
translation: When such a love is observed with that Lord, then He is realized; He is not achieved without bringing humility in the mind and all the four Vedas tell this.199.
End of the description of the adoption of Maid-servant as the eighth Guru.
Now begins the description of the adoption of the Trader as the Ninth Guru.

gurmukhi: Awgy clw jog jtDwrI ]ley sMig cylkw ApwrI ]dyKq bnKMf ngr phwrw ]Awvq lKw eyk bnjwrw ]200]
transliteration: Aage Chalaa Jog Jatdhdaree|| Lae San(i) Chelkaa Apdaree|| Dekhat Bankhannd Nagad Pahaaraa|| Aavat Lakhaa Ek Banjaaraa||200||
translation: Then taking his disciples alongwith him, Dutt, the Yogi with matted locks, moved further; when, passing through the forests, cities and mountains, they went forward, there they saw a trader coming.200.

gurmukhi: Dn kr Bry sBY BMfwrw ]clw sMg lY twf Apwrw ]Aimq gwm lvgn ky Bry ]ibDnw qy nhI jwq ibcry ]201]
transliteration: Dhan Kar Bhare Sabhai Bhandaaraa|| Chalaa Sarg Lai Taad Apaaraa|| Amit Gam Lavgan Ke Bhare|| Bidhnaa Te Nahijaat Bichre||201||
translation: His coffers were full of money and he was moving with a good deal of merchandise, he had many bags full of cloves and no one could enumerate them.201.

gurmukhi: rwq idvs iqn dRb kI Awsw ]bycn clw Cwf Gr vwsw ]AOr Aws dUsr nhI koeI ]eykY Aws bnj kI hoeI ]202]
transliteration: Raat Dicas Tin Drab Kiaasaa|| Bechanndchalaa Chhaad Ghar Vaasaa|| Aur Aas Doosar Nahikoee|| Ekai Aas Banaj Kihoee||202||
translation: He desired for more wealth day and night and he had left his home for selling his articles; he had no other desire except his trade.202.

gurmukhi: Cwh DUp ko qRws n mwnY ]rwq Aau idvs gwvn eI TwnY ]pwp puMn kI Aaur n bwqw ]eykY rs mwqRw kY rwqw ]203]
transliteration: Chhaad Dhoop Ko Traas Na Maanai|| Raat Au Divas Gadan Ithaanai|| Paap Pounn Kiaur Naa Baataa|| Ekai Ras Maatraa Kai Raataa||203||
translation: He had no fear of sunshine and shade and he was always musing of moving forward day and night; he had no concern for virtue and vice and he was only absorbed in the relish of trade.203.

gurmukhi: qw kh dyK d`q hir BgqU ]jw kr rUp Bgq jg mgqU ]AYs BwNiq jo swihb iDAweIAY ]qb hI purK purwqn pweIAY ]204]
transliteration: Taa Kah Dekh Datt Har(i) Bhagtoo|| Jaa Kar Roop Bhagad Jag Magtoo|| Aisbhaant(i) Jo Saahib Dhiaaeeai|| Tab Hipurakh Puraatan Paaeeai||204||
translation: Seeing him, Dutt, the devotee of the Lord, whose person was revered throughout the world, thought in his mind that in such manner the Lord be remembered, only then that Supreme Purusha i.e. the Lord can be realized.204.
End of the description of the adoption of he Trader as the Ninth Guru.
Now begins the description of the adoption of the Lady-Gardener as the Tenth Guru.
